tasks.task: Clear brush and cut down trees
subtasks: Identify areas with excess brush
Determine direction for clearing
Climb tree to judge height and position
Use tool to cut branches
axe to fell trees
grapple to lift heavy logs
Fell tree in desired direction
Grapple log onto the tractor
Transport log to appropriate location
Select a sapling or tree
Determine planting location
Prepare soil by loosening and removing weeds
Dig a hole appropriate for the tree
Place tree in hole and straighten
Backfill soil around roots, tamping down
Water the tree thoroughly
Identify ripe apples
Pick apples from the tree
Place apples into basket or container
Remove apples by twisting and pulling
*crusk* - perhaps disinfect hands after?
Transfer apples from basket to machine
Align apples with machine's feeding mechanism
Operate machine to process apples
Monitor machine to ensure correct operation
Wait for process to finish
Remove sealed containers or bags
Place sealed products onto a cart or conveyor
Check for leaks or damage during transfer

tasks.task: Wash apples using the wheeled machine
subtasks: Place apples into the machine's input
Start the machine to begin washing
Move apples through the washing cycle
Stop machine when cycle is complete
Remove washed apples from output
Identify machine with adjustable features
Refer to manual or previous settings
Turn knobs or levers to modify speed
Check for optimal performance after adjustment

tasks.task: Use a spade to dig holes
subtasks: Select the appropriate spade for the job
Position the spade at the digging site
Press down on the handle to initiate the cut
Rock the spade back and forth to break soil
Continue digging until desired depth is reached
Use foot to rest on the spade, maintaining pressure
Remove soil from the hole

tasks.task: Lubricate the tractor with a grease gun
subtasks: Locate the correct grease points on the tractor
Remove the grease gun from the storage
Apply grease to each joint or pivot point
Check for resistance and lubricate as needed

tasks.task: Operate a loader on a tractor
subtasks: Shift into the proper gear for loading
Approach the pile of apples to be loaded
Use the loader to scoop the apples into the vehicle
Avoid overloading and maintain balance
Unload apples at the designated area
Take an apple from the pile
Hold the apple securely with one hand
Using a sharp object like a knife, make a deep cut around the stem
Twist the apple into two halves
Gently peel the skin from the flesh
Check for core and seeds, remove if necessary
Discard the core/peels properly
Collect the peels from the processing area
Transport the peels to a compost pile or designated area
Spread the peels over the compost to aid decomposition
